campaign.story:
From Mat Groom, the co-writer of Marvel Comics' hit ULTRAMAN comics, and artist Erica D’Urso (CAPTAIN MARVEL and XENA: WARRIOR PRINCESS) comes INFERNO GIRL RED, an all-new original graphic novel that combines the high school super-heroic drama of INTO THE SPIDER-VERSE with the dynamic storytelling and world-building of Japanese tokusatsu superheroes, and the intrigue and relationship drama of British boarding school fiction.
Art by Erica D’Urso and Igor Monti
We all need something to believe in.  Especially Cássia Costa.
An ancient cult and their army of demons have stolen Cássia’s home, Apex City.  When a magical dragon bracelet rockets into her life and affixes itself to her arm, Cássia’s the only person equipped to stop the cult from offering the entire city to their dark lord.
There's just one catch...
Inferno Girl Red by Nicola Scott (w/ Annette Kwok), left, and Valeria Favoccia, right
The magical bracelet is powered by belief, and Cássia — an intensely pragmatic, rational girl – doesn’t have much to spare. She’ll have to find something to kindle her faith, though, and fast —because she has a secret legacy to live up to. Because her mother's life is on the line. And because Apex City needs Inferno Girl Red.
Hi! My name's Mat Groom. And this story, INFERNO GIRL RED, is one I’ve been working on for about three years now. I’ve always thought it was worthwhile, but I was never certain it would work… until I met Erica D’Urso. Erica is just wickedly talented. You can see that in her work on JAMES BOND, CAPTAIN MARVEL and XENA: WARRIOR PRINCESS. But it was her energy, her tremendous passion, that made me believe. Erica loves Cássia, and Cássia’s world… and that love infuses every part of this project. There’s nobody I would rather be co-creating this world with.

Inferno Girl Red Character Design
Together with colorist Igor Monti (who has a ultra-modern and vibrant style you'll recognise if you read MEGA MAN: FULLY CHARGED), letterer Becca Carey (a real star-in-the-making) and design agency For The People (a Top 10 Global Agency, according to D&AD), Erica and I are so excited to bring you this all-new 100-page superhero graphic novel.
INFERNO GIRL RED Creative Team
Kyle Higgins is editing this book. Kyle and I have been friends for half a decade, at this point. He has mentored me, in many ways (he edited my first comics series SELF/MADE), and more recently we’ve worked as a writing team on ULTRAMAN for Marvel Comics. We share a passion for the Japanese tokusatsu genre (which was a big influence here, along with British boarding school dramas and American superhero comics). And there’s little coincidence that Cássia was first introduced to the world in the back of the first issue of Kyle’s series, RADIANT BLACK. In fact, the connections between RADIANT BLACK and INFERNO GIRL RED may run deeper than you think…
Cássia’s not shy– but bouncing around from city-to-city as her Mom bounced from job-to-job meant it was hard to make friends... and any friends she did make disappeared pretty quickly once they found out who Cássia’s mother was. So instead of socialising, she focused on learning– showing a particular aptitude for science.

Cássia Costa Character Design
 
                     Now Cássia has a chance for a fresh start in Apex City. Her impressive test scores have earned her an invitation to the world-famous entrepreneur Doctor Janine Caro’s prestigious boarding school for promising young minds. There, Cássia starts to settle in. She starts to make friends. She starts to see a future for herself.
But when a magical bracelet blasts through a window while Cássia is studying late one night, everything changes. Cássia's quickly drawn into a strange war that she previously only heard about from her mother... 
Concept Art – The Griffin and Other Manifestations of Darkness
Concept Art – Cássia's Mom, and Other Mentors
Concept Art – New Friends

Ready to experience some of the story? Check out these five preview pages: 
Erica is a native Italian illustrator and comics creator, who has worked with some of the biggest characters and brands in all of fiction-- including IAN FLEMING’S JAMES BOND and XENA: WARRIOR PRINCES for Dynamite Entertainment, as well as THE LIFE OF CAPTAIN MARVEL for Marvel Comics.
Mat is a writer from Sydney, Australia. He's the co-creator and writer of SELF/MADE from Image Comics, is a co-writer on the ULTRAMAN series for Marvel Comics, and written for DC Comics projects including the CRIMES OF PASSION anthology and the TALES FROM THE DARK MULTIVERSE series.
Igor Monti is a colorist from Treviso, Italy, known for this ultra-modern and vivid style. His recent hits include MIGHTY MORPHIN POWER RANGERS and MEGA MAN: FULLY CHARGED, both from Boom! Studios.
Kyle Higgins is a #1 New York Times Best Selling author whose past work includes RADIANT BLACK, MIGHTY MORPHIN POWER RANGERS, NIGHTWING, BATMAN ETERNAL, ULTRAMAN, THE WINTER SOLDIER, HADRIAN’S WALL and THE DEAD HAND. Kyle made his debut as a comics editor in 2018, with SELF/MADE from Image Comics.
Becca is a letterer, designer and illustrator with a penchant for the handmade approach. Her lettering work ranges from household name characters (WONDER WOMAN, BATGIRL and HARLEY QUINN for DC Comics) to creator-owned sensations including RADIANT BLACK from Image Comics.
For The People is an Australian design, strategy and storytelling agency. In 2019, they became the first Australian agency ever to crack the top 10 in D&AD’s global ‘Design Agency of the Year’ annual review, sitting alongside the in-house design teams of Apple and the New York Times Magazine, as well as multinational industry giants like Jones Knowles Ritchie and Serviceplan Group.
 You may have noticed that Image Comics logo on our header. In the event that we're funded (and only in the event that we're funded), Image Comics has agreed to publish INFERNO GIRL RED in comic shops and book store markets.  But that will be a softcover. (It bears repeating, this book will only be made if we're funded.)
This Kickstarter campaign is the only place to get INFERNO GIRL RED as an oversized, deluxe format hardcover (7 x 11 inches) with an exclusive, Kickstarter-only cover and Kickstarter-edition-exclusive concept art. 
This edition will feature 100 pages of story (concept art and informational pages are additional to this page count).
Shipping within the US – $18 USD (approx.)
Shipping to Canada/Mexico – $26 USD (approx.)
Shipping to the UK – $14 USD (approx.)
Shipping to Europe – $22 USD (approx.)
Shipping to Australia – $28 USD (approx.)
Shipping to Brazil – $22 USD (approx.)
Shipping to the Rest of the World – $77 USD (approx.)

Shipping and fulfillment will be facilitated by ONS Printing.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is Erica and Mat’s first Kickstarter, but editor Kyle Higgins recently ran a successful Kickstarter for his Original Graphic Novel, THE TRAP. The entire team has had extensive experience producing comics for the world’s biggest comics publishers, to the highest professional standards and to deadline.

In the post-COVID world, shipping and fulfilment is obviously a little trickier than it once was. We've partnered with ONS Printing, an offshoot of Comics Experience run by comics professionals, to ensure it all goes off without a hitch.

Thanks for your support.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Your Guide to the Inferno Year
updates.update_content:
That's it. Our campaign is over.
First of all, I want to welcome the (significant number) of people who joined our campaign in the final days. Welcome, and thank you.
It's been quite a journey. I did a quick search of my inbox just now to confirm, and yes-- the first emails I have that reference this are from 2018. And I'm relatively sure I have notebook notes from 2017. Some ideas take a long time to come to fruition. Some never do at all. Thankfully, this isn't the latter situation... because all of you.
What started as idea of mine, was then expanded and improved tremendously by Erica D'Urso, Igor Monti and Becca Carey... has been brought into reality by all of you.

Hi again, everyone.
These updates have just become me praising and thank you every few days, haven't they?
Well, what can I say. That's your fault, not mine. You just keep coming through for us. Case in point: we have hit our mini-comic Stretch Goal. I'm so excited-- we get to share an extra story from this world with you, dig into a history that might have otherwise gone untouched, see more of Valeria Favoccia's take on this universe... I really think you're going to love it.

updates.update_userinfo: A goal, achieved-- plus, original Erica D'Urso IGR art available!
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!
A quick update for you today-- we've had a few requests from retailers to add a Retailer Reward tier...  so we're doing it!

updates.update_userinfo: New reward tier, and old friends.
updates.update_content:
Hey, everyone,  a quick one from me today!

First of all-- we're really coming up on our next Stretch Goal! If I'm currency-converting correctly (and I quite possibly am not!), we're about $5,000 USD away from hitting it. I'm doing a bunch of podcasts and things this weekend to help spread the word, but we always appreciate your support -- so if you feel like letting a friend know about our campaign, or retweeting a tweet... it would be hugely appreciated, as ever, and also get us ever-closer to this very cool little extra:

Hello again everyone,
We crossed a huge milestone a few days ago-- now, whenever I send out these updates, they're going out to over 1,000 people. That's... really hard to comprehend, if I'm honest. More than one thousand people have come together to help make our little project a reality... and not make it so little. To turn out little spark into a blazing inferno.
Again, I'm not really sure how to express my gratitude, except to say that Team IGR will be working as hard as we possibly can to turn your passion and support into something compelling and meaningful.

Hi again, everyone!
We're powering towards that ashcan mini-comic Stretch Goal-- they say the middle of a campaign is slow, but the momentum you've all been bringing is astonishing. Thank you.
We're not slowing down on our end, either-- and we thought we'd give you an update on how we've been promoting INFERNO GIRL RED around the internet, in case you feel like sharing!

We did it!!
Thanks to the incredible generosity and support of you all, we've hit our second stretch goal. That's right-- we'll be adding 20 pages of story to INFERNO GIRL RED, both digital and physical editions, free for all backers.
That's a 20% increase in story content, at no extra cost.

updates.update_userinfo: A lofty goal reached, a hidden history revealed...
updates.update_content:
Every day, you surprise me.
I keep expecting things to really taper off, but instead, our campaign just continues to grow.
Then, yesterday, we released something that, honestly, we didn't know if anyone would be into. The fully-wearable replica helmets. I mean, we thought they were profoundly rad, but would anyone else share that enthusiasm?

project_data.project_name: INFERNO GIRL RED by Mat Groom and Erica D’Urso

campaign.story:
JANUARY 2ND -- NOTE -- REWARD LEVEL "Pledge $30 or more De' jengva' wep je (CD + T-Shirt)" INCLUDES A PHYSICAL COPY OF THE CD! Something didn't save properly on that reward description but you will get a copy of the CD + a shirt. 

Qapla' batlh je! Success & Honor!
In 2014, I asked the question, "What would pop music sound like if it were entirely in Klingon?" The world jumped on board with me and together we created the first EP of pop songs translated into Klingon, Warrior Woman. In 2017, we all said, "Hey that was fun! Let's do it again!" and Fierce Songs came out. 
Over the last couple years, more people have joined the fun as yIbuSQo' found its way into blogs and Twitter feeds around the world. 
2020 was going to see The Klingon Pop Warrior & her intrepid Red Shirt back in the recording studio and then.... well, **waving hands around** global pandemic! I had a bunch of songs and a desire to make this thing happen despite shutdowns. So, I enlisted musicians from across the country that I either know from conventions or have worked with in the past and we all made home studio magic! It's pretty amazing what you can do in your own home nowadays and when you bring in a professional sound engineer it's absolute wizardry. This has taken a village to make happen and I'm so proud of what we all accomplished.
bommey! The Songs!
I've got some really fun translations and what I am most excited about is that I actually have translated more than half of these songs myself. While my first 2 EP's were almost entirely translated for me, my comfort and confidence with the language and grammar has grown. The songs on this new EP are (in no particular order):
 No Scrubs - TLC - Translator: Jen Usellis
 Maneater - Hall & Oates - Translator: Chris Lipscombe
 Born To Be Wild - Steppenwolf - Translator: Jen Usellis
 The Warrior - Patty Smyth w/ Scandal - Translator: Chris Lipscombe
 Good As Hell - Lizzo - Translator: Jen Usellis & Juliana Bukoski
Along with some able assists from translators, this EP would not be possible without fantastic musicians arranging & playing. I called in some serious favors on this one.
 No Scrubs - TLC - Craig Allen Hecht (guitar/drum) & John Abbey (bass).
 Maneater - Hall & Oates - The Faithful Sidekicks
 Born To Be Wild - Steppenwolf - Craig Allen Hecht (guitar/drum) & Barry Alverman (bass)
 The Warrior - Patty Smyth w/ Scandal - The Faithful Sidekicks & Craig Allen Hecht
 Good As Hell - Lizzo - Jen Usellis & a painfully simple cobbled together midi track that was polished into a diamond with all kinds of extras by John Abbey.
Craig & Barry are old bandmates of mine from when I lived in the Twin Cities. For almost 8 years we were in The Express Band together. The Faithful Sidekicks are an awesome filk duo originally from the Twin Cities but now out in the PNW and we did a trade! They did some tracks for me & I did some harmonies on their upcoming album. Me cobbling together a midi track was because we're in the middle of a pandemic and I felt bad bugging other musicians after how helpful and amazing everyone else had been. I decided to continue my trend of being a "Jack of All Trades, Master of None" and make it work!
Following up on the heels of the musicians is the incomparable John Abbey of Kingsize Studios here in Chicago. I had the pleasure of working with John at Kingsize when I did backing vocals for a local musician back in 2018. It was such a great experience and I loved the work he had done so I asked if he was interested in taking on the Pop Warrior.  His enthusiasm helping to not just mix these songs but fine tune them with extra instrumentation has been nothing short of miraculous. Working with him via email has been wild but he's really taken these tracks and turned them into something special which is no easy feat since he is working with other people's recordings.
Budget Breakdown
Producing a bunch of covers in another language isn't cheap and while I was spared the expense of a recording studio other things add up:
Song Rights ~ $400 (5 songs x 300 digital + 100 physical per song, may need to get more depending on final tallies) 
Translators ~ $300
CD's Printing ~ $660 (100 copies)
T-Shirts ~ $952 (based on previous campaign quantities +higher quality shirts)
Sound Engineer ~ $1500
Enamel Pins ~ $350 (based on a previous pin order, this could end up being a little bit higher)
You might notice that this math adds up to more than I'm asking for. I've managed to front some of these costs myself and use merch & digital sales that rolled in over the year to help get things done up to this point.
Rewards
Along with CD's, there are Kickstarter exclusive shirts with the CD cover art --NOTE: THE REWARD LEVEL "Pledge $30 or more De' jengva' wep je (CD + T-Shirt)" INCLUDES A PHYSICAL COPY OF THE CD! Something didn't save properly on that reward description but you will get a copy of the CD + a shirt. 
The back says: ghom'a' le' QutlhwI' Kickstarter Supporter

Enamel Pins: 
I have worked with Reppin Pins in the past & I have no doubt they will make this pin absolutely amazing. They are a Chicago-based design company and do great work! Any chance I can take to keep things local is a chance I love to take!
Not a final proof - this is the pin design, it will be the center image with the jagged edges and approximately 1.25 inches.
I will also make 8x10s of the cover art for signing & framing.
Zoom Listening Party for a group of backers - you will get a first listen to the finished EP as well as your mp3's ahead of all the other backers.
Producer Credit as a special thank you on the CD jacket plus a really nice signed matte plaque commemorating the event.
Private Zoom Concerts for you and up to 10 friends. Let's celebrate!

Stretch Goals
My Kickstarters have historically been very modest affairs and going "viral" isn't really something I anticipate based on that history. There are things I can potentially do if I hit additional funding goals with the first 2 being stepping stones to the 3rd & biggest one.

$5000 - Lyric Pins -- all backers who receive a physical reward will get a set of limited edition lyric buttons, one for each song on the new EP. These have been something I've created for Starbase Indy in the past. Some examples of previous buttons: 
yIbuSQo' (Let It Go), HIchop! (Kiss Me), bIHar 'e' yImevQo' (Don't Stop Believin'), QuptaHvIS maHegh (Die Young), Har'ey DunDaq vogh 'oH, puv chapar (Somewhere over the rainbow, birds fly)
$6000 - Emote Stickers -- all backers who receive a physical reward will get a set of die cut Pop Warrior emote stickers.  
The ultimate stretch goal though is......
$7500 - GET MY ENTIRE SONG CATALOG ON SPOTIFY- Over the years, I've been asked why isn't my music on Spotify. The answer is complicated. While many would consider what I do fair use/parody, not all rights holders see it that way. Paying for song rights is really important to me and doing things correctly is important to me. Even parodies require a certain amount of due diligence. Getting on Spotify or YouTube and other streaming services requires special custom rights and jumping through some legal hoops that I have avoided up to this point. The main reason is the cost and time it takes. All of my songs will need to be fully documented with the original English, Klingon, & back translations. My usual rights clearance source can handle it but it's a significant cost both monetarily and with the labor it will take for documentation gathering/creating.  If I'm going to put in the effort for 1 EP, I might as well do them all to consolidate the costs as much as possible but it will take resources. If this is something you have wondered about or inquired about, now is your chance to help make Spotify a reality. -- the timeframe to complete this will be a bit of a moving target. My goal is by end of August 2021.

I am so excited and proud to bring this music to you all. It has been a labor of love making this happen in the middle of a pandemic and I am so proud to be translating my own songs and having people continue to enjoy what I am doing.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I am most at risk of not meeting deadlines due to vendor turnaround time on the physical rewards. However, this isn't my first rodeo and I am working with all the same vendors as I have in the past. Additionally, all of the songs are recorded and mixed. Where my 2017 Kickstarter fell behind due to the recording & mixing being done during & after the Kickstarter, reward fulfillment on this is entirely in the hands of vendors I know are reliable based on previous experience. I will have as much done as possible so that I can hit send on everything once the funds are available.

The biggest risk with this project is the Spotify stretch goal. I could end up blocked by some of the artists' rights holders and this could end up changing how I do my rights for all of my songs going forward. Up until recently, there was no easy way to get streaming service rights. Fortunately, there are finally services out there that will help with this piece the puzzle and, while the documentation is pretty intensive, the process seems fairly straightforward overall.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Makin' ship happen.

campaign.story:
Rise of the Psycho Rangers:
Created from the power of the Dark Specter, the Psycho Rangers have risen! Designed to be faster, stronger, and smarter than the Power Rangers, each Psycho Ranger was created with the sole purpose of annihilating their Power Ranger counterpart!
With the Astro Megaship as their new command center and a whole new set of Zords to summon, can veterans Andros, Carlos, T.J., Ashley, and Cassie band together to overcome the assault of the terrifying Psycho Rangers?
This expansion also introduces Mastermind Mode, which allows one player to take control of the forces of evil, pitting player against player in a battle of wits!
Machine Empire:
The Royal House of Gadgetry has arrived to conquer Earth! With all of their mechanical might, the Machine King and his coterie prepare for battle. The Power Rangers' skills will be put to the test as they deal with the machinations of this catastrophic clockwork court. 
Meet the Machine Empire! The devious Prince Gasket, the heir to the throne, is joined by the enchanting Princess Archerina, while the egotistical Louie Kaboom plots their downfall. Big Bad General Venjix leads the empire's forces, and King Mondo himself rules with an iron fist and his terrifying Sword of Damocles. 
This expansion introduces the concept of paired monsters. Are you brave enough to face Prince Gasket and Princess Archerina together as a deadly double act?
campaign.risks:

Renegade Game Studios is an experienced publisher of board games. While Renegade is only 6 years old, it is composed of industry veterans including Scott Gaeta, President of Renegade, with over 20 years of experience in all aspects of the industry.

While there are always risks associated with any campaign, we will make sure that we communicate any delays or challenges we may experience along the way. We are already past many of the hurdles that can delay a project and do not expect any major delays. If we do, they will likely be in shipping and we will give you regular and detailed updates regarding any shipping issues.

Thank you for supporting our project!

campaign.story:
Keep your game organized and table theming powered up with GridMats!
Originally created to be compatible with Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid from Renegade Game Studios, these mats will give you a colorful surface to use during gameplay of that and other tabletop games.
About the Mats
Fabric surface game mats with a non-skid rubber backing
1/16” thickness for a low-profile and comfortable play surface
Full-color printing process for vibrant, permanent colors
Machine washable
I’ve created two GridMat designs — a Player Mat and a Battle Mat.
If you’re like me, I like knowing where to put all the pieces of a game — so I made something to help out! This 10”x15” mat allows each player to organize their game space, all the while adding to the game’s theme. It’s colorful, fun, and useful for beginners and pros alike!
Player Mat - Top View (Artist rendering)
Player Mat - Side view (Artist rendering)
Optional Color Options
The standard Player Mat has red as the main color, but other colors are nice too!  So, we're offering bundles that include 5 different colors. 
Five possible color varieties of Player Mats - Black, Pink, Blue, Red, and Yellow (Artist Rendering)
Every reward tier with multiple Player Mats has two versions - a single-color bundle and multiple-color bundle. But hey, good news! There is no price difference for choosing the multi-color reward options — they are the same price as the all-red mat bundles.
So, if you want lots of colors, please choose the multiple color option!
Green & White
I am now offering Green and White mats as part of some reward levels as well as an Add-On!
Green & White Mats - (Artist's Rendering)
If you do not want to change your current reward level and would like to add Green and White mats to your current reward, simply increase your pledge by $12.  I will send out a survey at the end of the campaign to make sure you get the mats you want.
Deck out your battles with this 9”x24” mat, themed with sinister dark magic-vibes. There are 8 spots for card placement, plus an area off to the right for keeping spare tokens or cards nearby — whatever helps your game session!  
Battle Mat - Top View (Artist Rendering)
Battle Mat - Side View (Artist's Rendering)
 Thanks to this amazing community of fans, the campaign reached the $3,200 mark!  So, I will be including a new mat in ALL multicolor reward tiers!  No extra money pledged required -- This one is on me!
 Introducing... Player Mat Z 
Player Mat Z (Artist's Rendering)
This alternate red Player Mat swaps the light grey colors out for green and the Colorful Meter gets turned to 11 and this one just POPS.
Want More Than One?
If you would like extra Player Mat Zs, simply add $6 to your pledge and I will ask you via survey for what extra mats you want.
For those backing the Double the Fun or Full Team-Up levels: You will receive only  one of these mats to your reward.  However, if you want an extra, like mentioned above, up your pledge by $6 and we'll get that handled!
Affordability was always my goal, so I targeted as to have these produced at a lower cost than standard retail for player mats, and I think I have succeeded. 
The rewards are based on the following prices:
Player Mats - $6 each
Battle Mats - $10 each
Note: The Hyper Set reward tier does have a slight discount!
[Updated 7-22-2019!]
US Orders
Rewards with less than 5 GridMats will ship in box at a cost of $8
Rewards of 5 or more GridMats will ship in a box at a cost of $13
International Shipping
Based on popular request, GridMats are now available to be shipped to Canada, the EU, and Singapore.  
Want your country added? Message me on Kickstarter or email me at gridmats@gmail.com.
Most of the tiers are priced between $30-40 for international shipping, with the smaller tiers being cheaper and the very large tiers (8+ mats) being more expensive.
 See our update on International Shipping for all the important info.
At the conclusion of the campaign, it will take a week to gather all the orders and send numbers to the manufacturer. The production estimate is around 14 days, with them then being shipped back to me for distribution to backers.  With this timeline, I am not promising reward fulfillment until October, but it could be sooner if everything goes smoothly.
Hi, I’m Alan - a big nerd who happens to have some skills with 3D modeling and rendering. When I decided to make some simple play mats, I “accidentally” let my imagination run wild. Before I knew it, I was building a complex scene in Cinema 4D — figuring out the best layout, crafting a flow of energy and a narrative to the design, and all that kind of nerdy stuff that I love doing! 
Player Mat Design scene in Cinema4D
The harder I worked, the prouder I became. And after posting my work in progress to other fans via social media to share my excitement and receiving a ton of excitement for the designs, I decided to find a way to get these made. So here we are!
I had way too much fun crafting these designs and I really hope it shows. Feel free to ask me questions about the design process — I would love to answer them!
Thank you for considering backing this project. I really hope to make these mats a reality for all of us!
If you have any questions, feel free to comment here on Kickstarter or email me at gridmats@gmail.com.
Disclaimer
This project is neither affiliated with nor endorsed by either Hasbro or Renegade Game Studios. This is a fan-made mat design, created with care to be compatible with a particular game while doing my best to avoid infringing on their intellectual property. I am a fan of both of these groups and would never want my intentions to be misconstrued as anything but admiration and support for their products and hard work.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This project faces a few challenges, but I’ve done what I can to minimize them.

Time is the biggest challenge. I am not a game store or even an online retailer — just a normal guy who has a day job and typical life responsibilities. Therefore, this project will be handled to the best of my ability given those constraints. I have several tactics in place to alleviate the time issues.

First off, the designs are done! By launching this campaign after the designs were already completed, I have avoided delays from the time-consuming creative aspect of the project.

Also, I have already identified a manufacturer, been in contact with them, and even had sample prints sent to me to confirm quality. They are simply waiting for final numbers to start printing. I do not have to start from scratch when it comes to finding someone to produce these mats.

And lastly, from my experience interacting on social media, the group of people I expect to back this project are part of a kind and supportive community. I would hope they can understand that I am simply one of their own trying to get something cool made. I will respond to questions as I can and will work as fast as possible to help them out, but in the end, if it takes a day to respond, I believe they will be understanding.

Another challenge is the design orientation during printing. The manufacturer cannot guarantee that every mat will be printed exactly vertically as there can be some “tilt” during the print. This is an unavoidable aspect of printing on a flexible surface. I am addressing this in two ways:

1. I've eliminated parallel elements near the edges of the designs. They would create a clear signal that the image is slightly tilted. I did my best to do so on both designs, wherever I could.

2. I will increase the production order by 10% to have extra mats. This way, any mats that are obnoxiously tilted can be pulled before the orders sent out to backers.

So, while I cannot guarantee that every mat will be perfectly orientated, I will do everything I can to minimize the errors.

I've done everything I can think of to make sure this project is as successful as it can be. I want to thank from the bottom of my heart anyone willing to back and support these mats' creation and production. I promise to work through whatever challenges arise to get these in backers' hands as soon as I can!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Whoa, hello?! What's this?
Hi everyone, it's me again.  Hope you're doing well and you're staying safe and healthy and, most of all, happy.
I have good news and bad news, but let's start with the GOOD STUFF, ok?
The Good News

updates.update_userinfo: You get a mat! And you get a mat! All backers are getting their mats!
updates.update_content:
Going Places
83% of GridMat rewards have made it to their final destination, and the remaining US shipments are out for delivery today!  All that remains are our wonderful international friends' packages, which I am following the tracking progress until they arrive.
I can't believe the mats are finally in people's hands and I have loved every message from those of you who have your mats and are enjoying them.  It makes my heart sing to know that they'll be on your tables as you're having fun.  Be sure to send pics of your play space at gridmats@gmail.com so I can see your game and mats in action!
  for Issues
It's October and the GridMats are all packed!

updates.update_userinfo: The Mats are Here! Reward packing starts soon!
updates.update_content: "Good news, everyone!"  9 boxes and 222 lbs later, the GridMats have all made it.  I wish you all could experience what it's like to flick through 100 mats stacked up -- it's a really cool feeling.

I am about to set the surveys to not accept address changes.  Upon further review, it turns out that Kickstarter will automatically add a 48-hour window for you to change your address once I set the surveys to be locked down.  You should be getting an email shortly as a notification of this deadline.
So, if anyone forgot to update your address, here's your chance!
Thanks so much!
The proofs are in! I've seen each GridMat with my own eyes and have held them in my hands.  And they look and feel great!

It's a short update, but as I promised to keep you informed at milestones,  here we are!
The Kickstarter funds have been transferred and the artwork has been approved digitally with the printing company.  They will send me physical proofs next week and I'll post once I have them in hand.  Hopefully everything is good-to-go and we'll go into production at that point, but that's still an unknown until I see the proofs.  For now, just know that the process is moving forward and we're one step closer to having our mats!

updates.update_userinfo: Pssst, hey! Want to see something cool?
updates.update_content:
It’s almost been a week after the conclusion of the campaign. Thanks to everyone who have already sent in their surveys. If you haven’t done so, please do so soon! Today is the last day to add Add-Ons to your pledge, so reach out to me if you want to add something.
So Many Mats
Did you know you all backed 815 mats??? Out of curiosity, I did the math and that’s over 220 POUNDS (100 kg) of mats!!! I can’t wait to have them all here to see the shear magnitude of that many mats all in one place.
Next Steps

campaign.story:
HERO BOOSTER is a project I've had ticking for over for quite some time.
The idea was simple. I wanted to make an easy and accessible card game with a nostalgic Kamen Rider-y, Power Rangers-y feel to it. I'd already had a lot of the character designs done from webcomics and other projects so the whole thing very easily fell in to place.
I wanted to emulate superheroes having fast paced, and kinda silly, power-ups in a card game, which is how the hex-card format came to be.
Each player starts with a set amount of Hit Points, and the objective of the game is to reduce your opponents HP to zero by summoning Heroes and boosting their power through ATK, DEF and Special cards. Drawing enough GUTS cards to allow you to bring you Hero to the battlefield and start boosting!
Say for example your opponent has a Hero with 6 defence and you have a Hero with 8 attack, if you attack your opponent loses 2 HP.
(The rules are still slightly being tampered with at this stage, but those are the basics)
HERO BOOSTER is light-hearted game, suitable for all ages. Particularly enjoyable if you like Henshin Heroes as I've include a few nods to tropes.
 *artwork possibly not final
My background is in self-publishing comics. Which I normally fund out of my own pocket.
Card games on the other hand are incredibly expensive to print in comparison. Those who are aware of my work will know that this is a project I've wanted to get off of the ground for quite some time.
Using Kickstarter will allow me to see this project through whilst also being able to reach a wider audience.
Nothing too complicated with the rewards. I just want to the get the game out there.
Each physical pledge reward comes with 1 ready to play HERO BOOSTER game plus some stickers and prints of the art work.
Mock-up expansion pack art work.
I'm also offering an Expansion Pack full of different Heroes and Power-Ups and neat pin badge of the HERO BOOSTER logo.
 Earlier in the year I printed a prototype, before I settled on the name I just printed DUZIDA!! on the back, after the webcomic some of the characters are from.
Early play-tests went down very well.
Though I have given myself a deadline of May 2019 to allow time for futher play testing and blind testing to ensure HERO BOOSTER is the best it can be.
 Quite simply, all of the funding for this project is going on printing of the game, the extras and postage.
I could make a chart, but that would seem silly. I just want to fund this project and let it loose on the world.
 At £1600;
-The limit on the Expansions packs will be removed, making more available.
-The use of a d20 for keeping track on your HP in game will be upraded to an HP dial with a custom HERO BOOSTER design (art work currently pending)
At £2000;-The number of cards in the basic deck is increased to 100. Allowing for either 2 decks of 50 per player or the option to use smaller decks with a extra cards to play around with.
-The d6 gets upgraded to have a custom design
-Power Up backers recieve and extra pin of Hundredman, the 100% funding mascot.
-Each backer will also get bonus holographic cards in addition to all the other perks. These cards will be Kickstarter Exclusive.
Once £2000 is broken the next strech goal will be revealed.
Also as an added bonus for reaching full funding, each backer will recive a Kickstarter exclusive card which will be won't be available anywhere else.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and challenges for this project I believe are minimal.

The artwork, thought some touching up is required here and there, is done. Some new cards need to be drawn. But I have allowed 4 months from the completion of the campaign to give myself time to do any extra work that is required so I can deliever the best product to you that I possible can.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Good evening.

As of tomorrow morning (Nov 20th), all backer rewards will have been sent out. Please keep in mind that outside of Europe it can take up to 6 weeks for parcels to arrive, but if rewards that have already been sent out are anything to go by, they won't take quite that long.
I'd like to once again thank you all for your support and for your patience as I've worked on this project that has been completely new territory for me. It's humbling to think that not only do people own, but they have been excited to own, this project that I've had on the back burner since 2014.

Hello all,
As of this week ive started shipping out rewards. So far it’s only Early Hero and Hero as I’m still waiting on the pins  We’re at 4 weeks now from proof aprooval so they shouldn’t be much longer.

Also if you’ve changed your address please do update the backer report!

Salutations.
I've been faffing around with the rule book/ playmat. I printed out some rule booklets a little while ago but I was never overly fond of them when I got them, I also didn't add any info on the special cards from the Expansion Deck so I would have needed to print out something extra that has minimal information on and that seemed a bit silly. I wasn't really sure what I was going to do with the reverse side of the playmats (which are A3 sheets folded down to A5 for those of you who are interested) so I decided to use that space for the rules of the game. I'll likely still include the original booklets I got printed though.

Good news! The expansion arrived. And it arrived a heck of a lot quicker than I thought it would. Though upon printing it looks like I confused myself a little bit, some files were saved in the wrong place which means there are 2 cards missing from the Expansion Deck. They're rather important so I've gotten those into production, judging by how quickly the expansion arrived, it shouldn't take too long (plus I didn't get hit with a customs charge this time!)

I've just sent the Expansion Deck to the printers 🙌 the ETA I've been given is around September 21. Once I've got confirmation of production being complete I'll start sending off the Early Bird and Hero pledges. So, providing nothing goes horribly wrong, we're looking at everything being sent out by the end of September.
Currently editing the artwork for the pins for Powered Up / Ultimate pledge levels.

Short and sweet with some good news this time!
At the beginning of next month, I'll be printing the last of what's required for Hero Booster. So that's the playmats (which will only be in production for a few days) the pins (which take 4-5 weeks to be produced) and the Expansion Deck (which will likely also take around 4-5 weeks, give or take)
This means, excluding any shipping hold-ups, that we're looking at early October for shipping.

Greetings.
So, like most places in the world right now, things have really eased up here which means I'm free to plow on with Hero Booster.
I'm aiming to get the pins and the expansion deck produced in and around August and September. slightly vague I know, but production times (especially for pins) are still slightly unpredictable. I decided I'm just gonna get everything done in one go, print what still needs to be printed, and just take the hit when it comes to postage. Once I've got everything, I'll send it all out.

Greetings.
There's not much I can offer in the way of an update again really I'm afraid.
The good thing about keeping my online store running during everything that's been going on is that it allows me to gauge what it's like to ship things out. I've found, during the incredible reduced postal service that we still have in the UK right now that 1) things are taking an incredibly long time to get from a to b and 2) larger packages seem to have more of a tendency to either take even longer or, in some cases, just not show up at all.

Hello all, 
I hope you're all keeping well with everything that's going on.
I just wanted to pop my head in. As you may have guessed, there's not been much I've been able to do with Hero Booster while the UK has been on lockdown. It's not exactly been the most practical or sensible time to try and ship ~100 packages out (let alone fork out the money for it!) I've started back at my day job this past week which means I'll be in a better place to pay for all that shipping in a while.

campaign.story:
Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid is a co-operative board game for 2-5 players that challenges your team to save Angel Grove from Rita Repulsa’s evil army of monsters. Work together to fight off the incoming horde while building up your strength to protect the city from the most dangerous monsters in the universe! Prepare for your destiny. It’s Morphin Time! 
 Learn to play!
Subject to Licensor approval.
Subject to Licensor approval.
Subject to Licensor approval.
Subject to Licensor approval.
Subject to Licensor approval.
Subject to Licensor approval.
Subject to Licensor approval.
Designed by Jonathan Ying - one of the designers behind Star Wars Imperial Assault, and Warhammer 40k Forbidden Stars, and the lead designer of DOOM the Board Game (2016) and Bargain Quest - Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid features incredibly detailed oversized plastic miniatures that bring the epic heroes of the hit action show to life.
Subject to Licensor approval.
Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid gives each player the chance to take the role of a Power Ranger, the heroes of Angel Grove who defend the earth against the evil Rita Repulsa and her nefarious foot soldiers. Each Ranger comes with a unique combat deck representing their special skills and fighting style. From the Red Ranger's leadership karate skills, to the Yellow Ranger's Sabertooth ferocity, to the Blue Ranger's tactical mind, each ranger brings a unique set of skills to the table. You'll need to use your powers well if you intend to save the world!
In each game you'll protect four combat zones that are being targeted by the evil Rita Repulsa. Each round, enemy forces will deploy onto these zones and cause chaos among the populace. Who knows what sort of strange monsters Rita has cooked up for the Rangers this time?
Subject to Licensor approval.
During play, Rangers must manage their actions and coordinate their defenses, moving to the locations under the most threat and doing battle with enemies while also finding time to rest and recover between engagements as they prepare to defeat the mastermind behind this plot.
Subject to Licensor approval.
During battle, each ranger and each enemy in the location will participate in the combat sequence. Enemy cards represent enemy actions and health. Rangers can attack these cards to disrupt their attacks. Each foot soldier card the rangers defeat removes one soot soldier figure from that location. Monsters are much deadlier foes with a variety of special attacks that you'll need to deal with and defeat before you send them packing!
Subject to Licensor approval.
A Ranger's combat deck represents their health, with each card played and blow sustained slowly whittling away at their options. They'll need to find time to rest or power-up at the Command Center if they want to stay fresh for the next fight!
Subject to Licensor approval.
As the Rangers defeat enemies and progress through the game, they'll unlock Zord cards which provide them unique abilities and special actions they can perform. Eventually they'll be able to unleash the full power of the mighty Megazord!
Subject to Licensor approval.
Each game reaches its climax with a confrontation with the enemy Master, a devastatingly powerful foe who must be thwarted if the Rangers wish to save the city! Do you have what it takes?
For a more detailed look into game play, check out our most recent updates!
Combat Details, Ranger Strategy Tips, and More!
Enemies, Location Boards, and more Game Play Info!
Leveling up and Zords!
Board Game Spotlight Game Play Video
 Hyper RPG Play throughs from Power Morphicon:
Shipping costs will be added to your pledge during the post campaign survey. We will do our best to keep the shipping costs as low as possible and have quoted shipping with a large number of different fulfillment companies worldwide to ensure that the lowest reasonable prices are found. 
Please note that we cannot ship to PO boxes. We'll make sure to remind you when we get closer to locking down addresses. 
Shipping Estimates:
US: $10-$25
Canada: $15-$30
Europe: $13-25 (we expect UK and western EU to be on the lower end)*
Australia: $20-$25
New Zealand: $25-$35
The Rest of the World: We are not able to ship this game to other regions.  
Kickstarter Exclusives will be printed in volumes intended to fulfill the Kickstarter plus very small amounts of extra items to cover damages and other issues that may arise. We reserve the right to sell any leftover items at conventions or on our website if practical to do so. 
Jonathan Ying is a talented and prolific game designer best known for his work on Star Wars Imperial Assault, Doom: The Board Game, The Game of Thrones Trivia Game, Bargain Quest (Second Edition on Kickstarter now!), and many more! His straightforward approach to design ensures that his games are easy to learn but intriguing and immersive.  Living in Southern California meant that we could meet up with him regularly as he developed the game. It was a great excuse to spend some time at our local hobby store testing the game. He is also one of the biggest fans of Power Rangers that we have ever encountered! We're so lucky to have Jonathan as the lead designer on Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid. 
 Renegade Game Studios is a successful board game company lead by industry veteran, Scott Gaeta. After only four years, Renegade has produced over 60 games, including seven different Mensa Select Award winning titles, one Kennerspiel Des Jahres nominated game, and numerous other award winning products. 
With an experienced team of eight full time members, Renegade has been able to produce  games ranging from accessible family games like Kitty Paw and The Fox in the Forest, strategy games like Clank! A Deck-building Adventure, and heavier projects including Ex Libris. In May 2018, Renegade successfully ran a Kickstarter for the Overlight Role Playing Game and is expected to start fulfillment at the beginning of September. 
With experience in all aspects of the board game industry, Renegade is excited to bring Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid to enthusiastic fans. 
We support friendly local game stores! The retailer pledge option is a deposit towards the full cost of your order. If you own a store and would like to participate, please contact us for the details.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Renegade Game Studios is an experienced publisher of board games. While Renegade is only 4 years old, it is composed of industry veterans including Scott Gaeta, President of Renegade, with over 20 years of experience in all aspects of the industry.

While there are always risks associated with any campaign, we will make sure that we communicate any delays or challenges we may experience along the way. We are nearly finished with the project already and do not expect any major delays. If we do, they will likely be in shipping and we will give you regular and detailed updates regarding any shipping issues.

Thank you for supporting our project!

Find out more about Renegade Game Studios at www.renegadegames.com

campaign.story:
Thank you so much for making Multiplex 10 a reality! 
— Gordon
 Multiplex 10 is an eleven-minute animated short about a schlock-loving movie theater usher named Kurt and a snobbish cinephile Jason, who come to realize they have just a little common ground in their mutual — but very, very different — love of film, which is a topic we think any film nerd can relate to.
Multiplex 10 is based on the comic strip Multiplex by Gordon McAlpin that ran from July 2005 through April 2017, which has been described as “Clerks in a movie theater” (Newsarama), with a “smart and human take on geek culture [that] is brutal, nuanced, and damn funny” (Gene Ha, Top Ten, Mae).
This animated version is part reboot and part prequel. While fans of the comic will love seeing these characters brought to life, we're hoping to reach a new, wider audience, as well. Fans of Community, The Office, and Clerks will all find something to love in the Multiplex 10 Cinemas.
Becky and Melissa (not final art)
Multiplex 10 will appeal to movie lovers, anyone who's ever worked a retail job, and anyone who's had an annoying friend who just can't shut up about why the things you like are terrible. While the short will stand on its own, we're hoping it can also serve as a pilot for full series.
But we can’t make this first episode without YOU!
Even long-time Multiplex fans may not know that — way before the comic strip began in 2005 — it was originally conceived as an animated short. But at that time, Gordon didn't have the resources to make it happen, so instead it evolved into a comic strip.
Now, with thanks to crowdfunding and a few years of 2D animation experience (storyboarding, designing, as well as final animation), he's thrilled with the idea of bringing the concept (and the characters) full-circle in Multiplex 10.
Watch “Multiplex: The Chosen One,” a student film by Gordon, to get a (very) rough feel for the tone of the Multiplex 10 project.
We’re also creating all-new Multiplex 10 comic strips leading up to events in the first episode, which will be featured on the Multiplex 10 website and the Kickstarter project updates.
 The team (so far) for the Multiplex 10 pilot includes:
Gordon McAlpin is the Executive Producer, director, lead animator, and co-writer on Multiplex 10. He’ll also be voicing Jason. He wrote and illustrated Multiplex from July 2005 through April 2017 and has produced three Kickstarter-funded Multiplex collections. Beyond comics, he is a freelance writer, designer, illustrator, and animator; you can see some of his earlier video and animation work on his portfolio site. 
Dana Luery Shaw is a Producer for Multiplex 10 and co-wrote the script. She has dreamed of making animation since she was a kid, and she has successfully tricked Gordon into making her dream a reality. She is currently the co-executive producer of digital series Personal Space; she also created the indie ARG The Wall Will Fall, and wrote for the webseries Echo Chamber and Classic Alice.
Joe Dunn is a Co-Producer on Multiplex 10 and will be voicing Curtis from Flickhead Video. He is a graphic artist living and working in the New York City area. He loves watching movies and drawing. He tries to do both non-stop. You may know his work from Joe Loves Crappy Movies or some other terribly-titled webcomic. Check out @joerules on Instagram and @joedunn721 on Twitter to keep up to date with his current nonsense.
Tom Brazelton is a Co-Producer for Multiplex 10 and will lend his voice to Kurt. He is the former artist/writer of the movie-themed comic Theater Hopper. He still enjoys writing and drawing, and he still likes movies (although, these days, it’s a lot more Pixar and a lot less Jim Jarmusch). Eventually, he’s going to get back in the game and publish some journal comics. Until then, follow @tombrazelton on Twitter, where he obnoxiously live-tweets SNL, and @tombrazelton on Instagram, where he uploads pictures of sunsets.
Chris Rager is a professional voice actor, perhaps best known for his roles as Hercule/Mr. Satan on Dragonball Z and Mr. Torgue in Borderlands 2. He’ll be lending his mahogany tones to The Blogger.
Aiyanna Wade will be voicing Becky, the shy science nerd at the Multiplex 10. Her more recent work includes YouTube Channel Awesome's Nostalgia Critic and cohost of the Awesome Comics podcast. She currently works on stage in Chicago and lives with her other half Jake and kitten Gideon.
Javier Prusky was born and raised in Montevideo, Uruguay. After relocating to Atlanta, he trained at The Company Acting Studio in Atlanta for three years. He graduated from Syracuse University with a BFA in Acting in 2016. He has also attended master clown Philippe Gaulier’s  at school in Étampes, France; studied Shakespeare at The Globe Theatre in London, UK; and studied On-Camera Technique at The Actor’s Space in Barcelona, Spain. He splits his time between Atlanta, New York City, and LA. Beyond acting, Javier enjoys anything involving nature and family. Whether it be hiking, SCUBA Diving, or rappelling, he feels at home with nature. His family, especially his mom, mean everything to him. In Multiplex 10, Javier Prusky will play Neil, a young manager at the theater.
Tangelene Bolton is a film composer in Los Angeles known for her powerful and distinctive melodies.  Upon moving to Los Angeles, she had the amazing opportunity to work for Remote Control Productions (Hans Zimmer) and now continues to work on projects in the realm of film, TV, and video games. She most recently worked on Rise of the Tomb Raider (Crystal Dynamics), Girlfriend’s Day (Netflix), and Jem and the Holograms (Universal). Tangelene's goal as a composer is to create an experience that lingers in the subconscious of the viewer, impacting and shaping their experience. You can listen to some of her work at Tangelene’s professional website and on SoundCloud.
Ian Vargo’s sound design has been heard on nationally-televised ad campaigns, award-winning short films, and viral web content. Most recently, he has worked with the Los Angeles directing team “Cousins,” whose videos have amassed over 30 million views on the internet. He’s also a music producer, mix and mastering engineer, and a multi-intrumentalist musician. Ian also teaches Audio Production at The Art Institute of California. He enjoys binge watching television while sitting on the couch with his wife Erin, Italian Greyhound Luigi, and fluffy cat Babycita. You can see some of his work on Ian’s professional website.
Additional cast will be announced in the coming weeks! Depending on the final budget, we’ll be able to hire additional animators, visual development artists, voice actors, and more. We will put out a casting call to fill some of the remaining roles shortly after the project is successfully funded.
Animation is an expensive and time consuming process.
The $15,000 goal we're asking for, minus approximately $2,750 for payment processing and Kickstarter fees — amounts to a little over $1,200 per minute for design, animation, voice acting, sound, music and distribution, which is extremely low-budget for animation.
But of course we want it to look and sound as good as it can!
At $20,000, we’ll be able to do a few extra things:
Smoother, 4K animation
5.1 Surround Sound mix
Theatrical premiere at the Somerville Theatre here in Somerville, MA. (All backers at the Special Thanks level and up will have free admission, though you will need to RSVP… and, of course, transportation is not provided.)
A Multiplex 10 comic book collecting the Multiplex 10 story comics (including as-yet-unpublished material) PLUS new material, reformatted into a single, continuous comic book — free to all $25+ backers.
And we'll have a bigger distribution and promotion budget to submit the film to film festivals and/or digital distribution platforms like Amazon Prime, iTunes, etc.
The screenplay is already written (aside from a few movie references we’ll update as close as possible to release, to keep them timely), and most of the characters have already been designed (as you can see in the project video). Pre-production can begin in earnest as soon as the project passes its goal.
Storyboarding, visual development, and the rest of the design work will take two to three weeks. (The backgrounds seen here and in the pitch video are from the comic strip.) Once the storyboards are complete, we'll make an animatic, editing together the boards (with some rough animation) and adding temp sound and dialogue.
Kurt and Jason get philosophical (not final art)
Over the course of six to eight weeks (approximately), we'll slowly replace the storyboards with finished artwork, sound, and dialogue, fine-tuning the edit along the way, before doing the final, polished animation in sync with the dialogue. Depending on the final budget, we'll be able to bring in other animators to help make the animation more fluid.
Next, we'll lock down the edit, let the composer work her magic, and do a final mix. This step will take a few weeks.
Finally, we'll master the final video files and release the short to the backers here on Kickstarter! With a projected release of September 2017, the four month production schedule should be plenty of time to complete the project.
We'll be exploring various distribution channels for the completed short and avenues for funding a full season, so it will NOT be immediately available for free streaming.
Backers can support the short and get — of course — desktop and mobile wallpapers, PDFs of the "shooting script" and the storyboards, DRM-free digital files of the rough animatics and the finished short, hand-drawn sketches, appearances as background characters or other non-speaking roles, and even producer credits!
At the $100 level, The Art of Multiplex 10 ebooklet will include concept sketches, promotional art, and all of the Multiplex 10 comics leading up to the first episode in a high res, vector-friendly (where possible) PDF format.
Three vector portraits (your appearance in the short will likely be slightly simplified to fit the design of the animation)
  Some sketches by Gordon McAlpin
You can see the various reward levels along the right side of this page, but here's a handy breakdown of the various rewards:
Be sure to read our project updates for more information!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Gordon has previousy run and fulfilled two successful Kickstarter projects, and I'm in the process of fulfilling a third, for the third Multiplex print collection. That print run is currently in transit from the printer and should be arriving in (approximately) mid-May, so shipping the rewards may overlap with the production of the short (assuming this project is successfully funded).

Creatively speaking, this will be Gordon's longest, animated narrative short — so that will undoubtedy present some challenges. But, based on his experience with writing, designing, storyboarding, and animating several animation projects (not to mention the last twelve years of working on the Multiplex comic strip), he is up for that challenge.

We have a very strong script already written, and a generous time frame to produce the animation in order to meet the projected September release. That said, filmmaking is an organic process, and hiccups will undoubtedly arise.

As with all of the Multiplex book Kickstarter projects, backers will be kept informed about our progress with frequent updates, so you'll know if and when there are any unforeseen problems — and how we’ll solve them. But the funds raised by this Kickstarter project will give us the resources to complete this project.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Last call for supporting Multiplex 10: The Web Series!
updates.update_content:
The Multiplex 10 Finishing Funds Indiegogo campaign ends in less than twelve hours!
The funding we raise before midnight TODAY (Eastern time) covers the final web series episodes. At this time, we have a little over $3600; we can do the already-in-production two-minute episode for the base goal and one other (short) episode with that.
We’d love to get over $5,000, which would ensure that the episode can be at least two minutes long—or even $7,500, which would ensure that we can make four more minutes (possibly one long episode, maybe two short ones?).
As the series winds to a close, I wanted to thanks you again for getting this ball rolling by funding (and the first few web series episodes) here on Kickstarter. Thank you for your support—past, present, and hopefully future!

updates.update_userinfo: Multiplex 10: The Web Series is funding on Indiegogo
updates.update_content: Much like the Multiplex 10 Second Chance campaign was used to help with the release of the animated short you so generously backed three years ago, we’ve just launched a "Multiplex 10 Finishing Funds" campaign to help us make a final(?!?!?!) set of web series episodes—which isn’t to say this is the last you’ll see of Multiplex 10.

It's been a while, huh?

I hope you've enjoyed the short film and the web series episodes we've been producing all year. And if so, we've just launched a new Kickstarter project to help fund even more animated Multipex 10 goodness: Multiplex 10: The Web Series.

Just a very quick note to let you know that I've got a NEW newsletter going that will keep you up to date on all things Multiplex 10, Multiplex, and me (like a couple of in-development animated short ideas that I hope will come to fruition). campaign.story:
Miss the livestream? We recorded Burnie, Barbara, Jon, and Tyler playing a round of Million Dollars, But... The Game!

Million Dollars, But… The Game (MDB) is a game that puts your morals and imagination to the test, posing the question, "What would you do for a million dollars?" Players create scenarios by combining a Trigger and a Rule card to showcase what they would or wouldn’t do for a big hunk of cash. (For example, A Million Dollars, But… Every time you see a store having a sale, you poop your pants a little bit.)
The best part of the game occurs when everyone debates the scenarios that have been presented to the judge. “Does it include online store sales or just in-person sales?” “How much poop are we talking: a rabbit pellet or an uncomfortable amount?”
MDB is a widespread communal project, spanning across half a dozen different departments within Rooster Teeth. It’s based on Rooster Teeth’s massively popular hit-comedy series, Million Dollars, But….
If you’re ready to see how far your friends, neighbors, family members, coworkers, random people on the airplane, or strangers will go for a million dollars, check out this game. We think you’ll like it as much as all of us here do.
We love all of you weird and amazing people. You ready for some #ButStuff?
<3 Rooster Teeth
So you wanna play a few rounds of MDB, huh? Well, gather up a few “friends,” prep your cringing muscles, and put on your best imagination cap. It’s time to get weird for a million dollars.
Setup of the Game
Each player takes 4 black Trigger Cards and 4 gold Rule Cards. Put together, these cards create scenarios. Now, pick a judge from your group of friends. Maybe the person with the biggest feet?
How to Play
Each player will hand a full scenario (remember, that's 1 black Trigger Card and 1 gold Rule Card), face-down, to the judge. See below for an example scenario.
One at a time, the judge will read the scenarios out loud to the group. This next part is where we think the fun of MDB lives. All players will attempt to glorify or downplay the scenarios, regardless of whether he/she put down that particular scenario. 
The judge will then pick the scenario they absolutely WOULD NOT do for a million bucks. The winner of that round is the new judge. 
Players then draw back up to 4 of each card type. (Always have 4 black Trigger Cards and 4 gold Rule Cards.)
How to Win
Be the most depraved person on the planet.
No, but seriously. To be the overall winner, be the first player to win 5 rounds.
Other Game Styles
Every core game comes with rules for three additional styles of play with their own goals. While we made a game with enough structure to support rigid rules, we also wanted to create a structure that allows players to make their own horrid/perverse/fun rule sets.
Why don't you create your own rules? Let us know what you and your deviant friends come up with!
STRETCH GOAL #1: Livestream with the cast!  Unlocked by reaching our goal within 24-hours 
STRETCH GOAL #2: Upgrade EVERY SINGLE core box set to a 400-card deck
Unlocked by accomplishing eight achievements on May 13, 2016
STRETCH GOAL #3: Upgrade EVERY SINGLE core box set to a 500-card deck
Unlocked by accomplishing 17 achievements on May 25, 2016
STRETCH GOAL #4: We begin development on a Million Dollars, But... MOVIE
Unlock this stretch goal by completing all 26 Achievements
Updated DAILY at 1:00pm CT
When Lazer Team was crowdfunded, there were a lot of emotions. Elation that over 37,000 community members had helped fund a movie, fear over the fact that it was now time to shoot the movie, trepidation over what was still to come for the next 18 months, and even excitement about what would happen next.
From July 2014 to present day (May 2016), it has been a whirlwind of perk fulfillment. BTS episodes. First shipment. Strangerhood Season 2. Signed perks. Game Time episodes. Lots of content and items have made their way into our backers' loving hands. And you know what? Every step of the process was FUN.
But that wasn't all. By having Lazer Team open to the public, away from our comfortable home of RoosterTeeth.com, new friends found us. They found a project that interested them and LATER found out everything else about Rooster Teeth.
That's why we are crowdfunding this game. Million Dollars, But... The Game is a fun and racy card deck that we want everyone and their weird neighbors to play. What better way to get it out to the public than launch it here on Kickstarter?
Meet the Team and Hear our Story
Back Row (Left to Right): Joe Rozsa, Brian Reilly, Burnie Burns, and Michael Hadwin
Front Row: Patrick Schmidt, Becca Frasier, Andy Messner, Chelsea Atkinson, Barbara Dunkelman, and Tom Lusardi
Cell Phones: Geoff Ramsey and Blaine Gibson
The game was developed overnight. No, really it was. Our story started on the last Friday of February when Brian Reilly, Associate Producer for Rooster Teeth Games, was intercepted by Burnie Burns, Rooster Teeth’s Chief Creative Officer, in the kitchen of Stage 5 in Austin, TX. He presented the idea of a Million Dollars, But… card game to Brian, to which Brian responded, "Oh yeah, totally. No brainer! I bet we could mix this and that mechanic and mimic the show pretty easily."

Brian went back to his desk and started spitballing ideas with Andy Messner, the Senior Producer for Rooster Teeth Games. The next day there was a prototype with about 80 cards. By the end of the week, the games team pitched their prototype to the cast and crew of Million Dollars, But… And with that, history was made.
From there, we tapped into the sickest corners of Rooster Teeth employees’ minds, sourcing triggers and rules from anyone who was willing to contribute. After a series of cross-company playtests, the games team locked down the game design.
We all know games need to look pretty, so Rooster Teeth’s badass graphic design team took over at that point. Patrick Schmidt and Tom Lusardi worked their asses off over the span of two weeks to design all the assets, cards, and packaging necessary for a complete game. As final art came in, Joe Rozsa, Rooster Teeth’s VP of E-Commerce, facilitated a relationship with printers in China, ensuring we’ll be ready to crank out the game as soon as it’s funded.
All in all, after a lot of cross-team collaboration and hard work, here we are. We're all pretty damn excited to see what you sick bastards would do for $1 million.
Contact Us!
Twitter: @MDBGame (use the hashtag #ButStuff to get our attention)
Facebook: Million Dollars, But: The Game
Rooster Teeth Group: Million Dollars, But... The Game

Questions? Comments? Concerns? Interested in being our backer for the Mystery Perk? Email us at MDBgame@roosterteeth.com and we'll help you out!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge that we could face is if we receive an unprecedented number of backers and do not have enough box sets or expansion packs to fulfill all of those orders in a timely manner. 

Our solution would be to create additional production runs with clear estimated ship dates for future orders.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Backer Update #17 - Coins, Expansion Packs and More Info!
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone, my name is Joe Rozsa. As the head of consumer products for Rooster Teeth, I hope to be able to provide answers to your questions about MDB The Game; the campaign, shipping and fulfillment. After reading and responding to comments here, we have combined some of the most common questions to put here in one location.
We have been reading your feedback and working hard to find the best and most accurate answers to all of your queries. We know it can be frustrating not having the answers immediately, but sometimes the right answer is not easily found – even for us. The last thing we want to do is give you bad information and then have to correct ourselves later because we didn’t have all the information necessary.

Hello! 

Over the last week we have seen inquiries and questions as we have begun shipping out copies of Million Dollars, But... The Game and the Expansion Pack - 1st Run. Here are some of the most common questions and their answers. 
I got my core game, but not my expansion pack? 
You are most likely in the second production run and will receive your expansion pack in August. If you believe you are a First Run Backer, email us at MDBgame@roosterteeth.com


Check out your Pledge on and look at the description. If you are in the second production run, it will say that. If you are in the second production run it means you will receive your core box NOW and your expansion pack in August 2016.


Send us a photo (to MDBgame@roosterteeth.com) of the damage and we will work with you to decide the best course of action.


More information will be sent to you shortly regarding this issue.


The challenge coin will be shipped separately in later July.


The cards will be shipped separately in August.


While we don't control the labor issues in other countries, we will do our best to help work through this issue with our customers. More information will be sent to you shortly regarding this issue.


Immediately answer your survey (.) We will be shipping out your items to you as soon as we can.

Hi everyone,
Shipping confirmation emails to those of you who answered their surveys by Tuesday June 21st are still going out to people
I have also received quite a few emails from people who received their confirmation only to see that the wrong address was written.

THAT'S RIGHT, BACKERS! We started shipping today!
Thousands of shipping confirmations were sent to Backers today as Core Box Sets and 1st run Expansion Packs were boxed up to be shipped out.

campaign.story:
TEENAGERS WITH ATTITUDE: BACK TO ACTION is a Power Rangers fan film webseries that will continue and conclude the fan trilogy set into motion by our two previous fan films "Teenagers With Attitude" and "Zordon of Eltar." All of our work so far has been building up to gain experience and the trust of Power Rangers fans worldwide to bring you this project.
Plot Synopsis: The 'Teenagers With Attitude' have blossomed into seasoned veterans since they began protecting the Earth from Rita Repulsa's relentless attacks. In a bid to stop Zordon at his own game Rita hatches a sinister scheme to combat the Power Rangers with a Ranger of her own: the Evil Green Ranger... Will a mythical new Power and help from an unlikely ally be enough to stop Rita and save their friend?
TEENAGERS WITH ATTITUDE was filmed in a day as a side project to ZORDON OF ELTAR. The cast met each other for the first time the morning of filming. We want to put as much time and effort into TWA2 that we put into the ZORDON OF ELTAR fan film.
TWA2 will be a feature length film that is projected to be 100-110 minutes in length. We plan to split this film into 3-4 episodes that will be released online for free for anyone to watch.

Please note that THIS WEBSERIES WILL BE FILMED ALL AT ONCE using the funds from this campaign. There will not be long breaks between the episodes. Period.
TWA2 will feature morphed Power Ranger battles, zord battles and much more. All of our work thus far has been leading up to what we believe will be an epic fan film webseries. With your help that dream can become a reality!
The original cast from TEENAGERS WITH ATTITUDE will be returning along with two new faces.
Rita Repulsa and her minions are set to return for TWA2 as well.
Don't count out Alpha 5 in TEENAGERS WITH ATTITUDE 2 either! With Rita's new scheme it will be all hands on deck!!!
Here are our two recent fan films set in this re-imagined fan-created universe:
ZORDON OF ELTAR (2015) *just released*
TEENAGERS WITH ATTITUDE (2014)
The almighty Dragonzord will triumphantly return in TWA2. The Megazord vs. Dragonzord will be a fight for the ages!
After working on both "Teenagers With Attitude" and "Zordon of Eltar" fan films" we learned a thing or two about how to stretch a dollar. But the scale and scope we have in mind for this webseries requires more than we can reasonably afford. The biggest and most important need for our budget would be to ensure timely creation of the costumes, props, modestly compensate and feed our cast and crew, provide transportation for our guests and honor our rewards to our generous backers.
Here's just one of the MANY concepts we came up with for TEENAGERS WITH ATTITUDE 2. And, yes, love it or hate it, that is a gold visor!
The helmet for TWA2's Red Ranger costume is almost ready to go! With your help we can acquire the remaining helmets we need! Boy are they pricey!!!
 The experienced and talented folks at Snakepit Studios have been gracious enough to work with us to provide Power Ranger bodysuits for our fan film! To save on funding we can stick with their pre-made suit designs but with higher funding we could work with them to create our own design! Either way we're in good hands! You might have seen their suit design in their joint project with Bat in the Sun from the hit "Green Ranger vs. Ryu" video!
ZORDON OF ELTAR couldn't have been made without your guys' backing. TWA2 will be no different.
 Why do you hum or sing your favorite song? Or dress like your favorite character for Halloween or at a convention? We are doing this fan film because we simply want to enjoy the experience of creating it. That's it. There is no "end game" here besides having fun creating entertainment for ourselves that we can also share for free.
Together our team represents a merry and diverse collection of creative and talented men and women. Our goal with this project -- our endgame -- can be summed up with these three primary objectives:
1) Have fun creating a film project together
2) Create something we would enjoy to watching together as a group
3) Share this project for others to watch for themselves and hope they enjoy it as much as we did creating it.
That's why we're doing a fan film and what makes the experience so grand. Period.
 Aside from DVD copies of our fan films, signed mini-posters and midnight screening access to TWA2 episodes before they release there are some other cool rewards you can receive by donated to our fan film.
ANGEL GROVE PRIDE perk gets you a shirt just like Jason's from TEENAGERS WITH ATTITUDE.
ELTARIAN SCHOLAR perk gets you an Eltarian mask like Zordon's from ZORDON OF ELATR.
DRAGONZORD SUMMONER perk gets you a limited re-imagined flute prop just like Rita Repulsa and the soon-to-be Green Ranger!.
Want Zordon's Armor from ZORDON OF ELTAR? Help me clean out my closet with the ZORDON'S BATTLE COSTUME perk.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We can't predict the future but in our previous experience with the last two Power Ranger fan film projects we successfully completed we have run into a few snags here and there but ultimately we OVERCAME them. And that's most important.

With your pledge it is OUR pledge as a team of experienced filmmakers to bring you all a quality project. If it hasn't been evidenced to you already we are truly doing this project for fun going out of our way to make this project anything more than what it is. This is simply a FAN FILM and we want nothing more than to complete this project to share it with you all whether you are a Power Ranger fan or not.

This fan film is in great, dedicated and battle-tested hands. We just ask for your help.

Thank you. And may the power protect you!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.creator_bio:

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our artists haven't started drawing yet, since we want them to be compensated for their work, as soon as this project is funded they will start. One problem that could arise would be if an artist can not make it in time for the deadline, they would not be included in the printed book. However, we do have back-up artists, and will be taking progress updates throughout the whole process. We will also be keeping the official tumblr for Fifth Element art-book updated on whether an artist will still be in book close to the deadline.

Backers will be informed about every step we make putting the book together, to the packaging of the books, and to sending them out...etc!

The only real small problem we expect are printing and shipping delays. The book and the extras are estimated to be shipped out in September or October.
